intro: Rhamnus robusta, commonly known as the common buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Europe, western Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 2–6 meters and has dark green, oval-shaped leaves that turn yellow in autumn. The plant produces small, black berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. Rhamnus robusta is characterized by its smooth, reddish bark and its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types. It is often found in woodland edges, hedgerows, and disturbed sites.
